13:59 <vmassol> hi  
14:09 <vmassol> has quit  
14:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <vmassol> hi there  
15:28 <vmassol> I'm hesitating about something  
15:29 <vmassol> I'm fixing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13976 and at the same time I've started changing the location where pages are exported  in the html export zip  
15:29 <vmassol> right now they are at the root with names such as:  
15:29 <vmassol> xwiki.Main.WebHome.html  
15:29 <vmassol> I started putting them in pages/xwiki/Main/WebHome.html  
15:30 <vmassol> but since this has some impact on several places in various part of the code I'd like to make sure this is a good idea  
15:31 <vmassol> note that attachments and resources in general are already put in subdirectories  
15:35 <vmassol> my other rationale was about scaling in case there are lots of nested spaces but not sure it makes a difference after all  
15:35 <vmassol> any opinion?  
15:38 <gdelhumeau> I don't think it make a difference for the zip archiver  
15:40 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] performing the release  
15:40 <mflorea> has quit  
15:42 <tmortagne> technically it makes no difference for the zip archiver yes, also it's internal things IMO and there is no retro-compatibility involved  
15:43 <tmortagne> on the filesystem side having folders is safer than one big file name  
15:44 <tmortagne> (there is a limit on filename size which is usually lower than on path size)  
15:44 <vmassol> yes and the other point is the limit of files in a single directory but that's pretty huge ;)  
15:44 <tmortagne> now in practice our complete reference cannot be bigger than 255 characters right now so it's not a huge issue in practice  
15:45 <vmassol> let's say that I'm halfway though this refazctoring so I need to choose if I revert of continue...  
15:45 <vmassol> s/of/or  
15:45 <tmortagne> I guess the most important is that folders makes easier to find your document  
15:45 <vmassol> another issue is the entry point  
15:45 <vmassol> after my change there's no more easy entry point  
15:46 <tmortagne> yes and there is no way to create a link to the current page since there is no standard for links  
15:46 <tmortagne> you could crate an index.html with a redirect meta in it to the current page when the export was done  
15:47 <vmassol> yes I coud use the current page as the entry point  
15:47 <tmortagne> s/crate/create/  
15:47 <vmassol> current page = current page when the export. is done  
15:47 <vmassol> but I'd need to handle the case when the current page is not in the exported HTML  
15:48 <tmortagne> in that case no index.html  
15:48 <tmortagne> we'll see if someone complains  
15:48 <tmortagne> another possibility is to generate a toc style index.html  
15:48 <tmortagne> even easier  
15:49 <vmassol> not that easy :)  
15:49 <tmortagne> you have the list of exported pages  
15:49 <vmassol> indeed  
15:49 <vmassol> but possibly less nice than a single entry point  
15:49 <vmassol> unless there's no entry pojnt  
15:49 <tmortagne> lets say a toc with the exported pages plus a link to the current one when the export was done  
15:49 <vmassol> in which case it's nice  
15:49 <vmassol> yes  
15:50 <vmassol> more work for me though :)  
15:50 <tmortagne> some kind of export report in other words  
15:50 <tmortagne> you can link with a simple link and a <ul>  
15:50 <tmortagne> not a big work  
15:50 <tmortagne> s/can link/can start/  
15:50 <systemd> has quit  
15:51 <tmortagne> well the issue was reported on 7.4.4 which is not very far from the version where it was broken  
15:51 <vmassol> ok so conclusion is that we're ok to continue on the path I started  
15:51 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <tmortagne> it's more consistent with all the other way of storing documents  
15:55 <vmassol> btw I could also move attachment next to the page now….  
15:55 <tmortagne> s/way/ways/  
15:55 <vmassol> instead of having an "attachment" root  
15:55 <tmortagne> the difficulty is colision  
15:55 <vmassol> I'll keep this one for later…  
15:55 <systemd> has quit  
15:55 <vmassol> I'd have a directroy naemd after the page  
15:55 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <vmassol> and inside that dir, the attachments for the page + some page.html file  
15:56 <tmortagne> sure but you need to differenciate between attachment and subpages  
15:57 <vmassol> file and directory?  
16:03 <tmortagne> you can't have a folder which have the same name as a file  
16:04 <tmortagne> (not sure for all filesystem but you can't on ext4 at least from what I see)  
16:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok I thought it was possible  
17:00 <vmassol> so indeed there would be a collision issue then  
17:00 <vmassol> better keep the attachment folder then
